result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for Zero days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA Sample by 7-22-2022 or face additional penalities.
DNA imposed and payable in 9 Months or Civil Judgment.
Pay supervision fees determined by DOC during term of probation.
Court waived all other non mandatory and mandatory cost, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Maintain/Obtain Full employment and /or attend school.
No possession of firearm during term of probation except during the firearm safety course.

Upon successful completion of probation sentence Court will allow for expungement. 
Court notes expungment is not contingent on payment of fees/fines/costs.

Complete an Anger Management Course.
Upon recommendation from agent the Court will allow for Early termination of probation.
Complete Firearm Safety Course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse A Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Jesse A

records.addlTxt:
SENTENCING HEARING PROCEEDED. Statements made all parties.

 AS TO COUNT 1: COURT ORDERED 
Defendant to serve 60 DAYS the House of Correction  with credit for  Zero days  time served. 
Huber for employment. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 9  Months. 
 
DNA imposed and  payable in 9 Months or Civil Judgment.
Court waived all other non mandatory and mandatory cost, fees and surcharges  due to in ability to pay. 
Pay  supervision fees determined by DOC during term of probation. 
Complete an Anger Management Course. 
Complete a Firearm Safety Course.
No possession of firearm during term of probation except during the  firearm safety course. 
20 Hours of Community Service.
Maintain/Obtain Full employment and/or attend school
Contact Probation and Parole by 7-18-2022. 
Provide DNA Sample by 7-22-2022 or face additional penalties.
Upon successful completion of probation sentence Court will allow for expungement.
Court notes expungment is not contingent on payment of fees/fines/costs. 
Upon recommendation from agent the Court will allow for Early termination of probation
Appellate Rights Given.

Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
 
AS TO COUNT 1:  PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  
Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. 
Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. 
Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge.

Defendant Jesse A Smith in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Calendar Call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court Canceled stayed bench warrant.  Defense request to proceed with plea and sentencing.

Attorney Tedia K. Gamino in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing.  DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance and request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner and no action on bail and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.  Calendar call scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Elements of the Offense/  WIS JI - Criminal

Defendant Jesse A Smith in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense request a plea and sentencing hearing. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 
This hearing will be held in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jesse A Smith in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference.
Court advised defendant the State Public Defender Office need additional time to appoint counsel.
Defendant provided the next court date. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse A Smith
Current: 4118 W Capitol Drive Apt 2, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 03-10-2022)
Prior: 6780 West Appleton Avenue #25, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Jesse A Smith in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/10/22 @ 1p
